textBeforeTable: Recommended reading Further reading 9. When on community visits or homestays, refrain from giving gifts or money to locals. 8. Please ask and receive permission before taking photos of people, including children. 7. Refrain from supporting businesses that exploit or abuse endangered animals. 6. Shop for locally made products. Supporting local artisans helps keep traditional crafts alive. 5. Learn some local language and don't be afraid to use it - simple greetings will help break the ice. 4. When bargaining at markets, stay calm, be reasonable and keep a smile on your face. It's meant to be fun! 3. Always dispose of litter thoughtfully, including cigarette butts. 2. For environmental reasons, try to avoid buying bottled water. Fill a reusable water bottle or canteen with filtered water instead. 1. Be considerate of Papua New Guinea’s customs, traditions, religion and culture. Top responsible travel tips for Papua New Guinea Intrepid is committed to travelling in a way that is respectful of local people, their culture, local economies and the environment. It's important to remember that what may be acceptable behaviour, dress and language in your own country, may not be appropriate in another. Please keep this in mind while travelling.
